question: How many authors are there for this paper?
sub_query: List all authors of this paper.
document_path: https://zhujuneray.github.io/assets/provenance/data/paper/raw_data/A Lived Informatics Model of Personal Informatics.pdf
final_answer: The paper in question has a total of six authors. The authors are F. Cordeiro, D.A. Epstein, E. Bales, A.K. Jagannathan, G.D. Abowd, and J. Fogarty.
sub_answers: The authors of this paper are F. Cordeiro, D.A. Epstein, E. Bales, A.K. Jagannathan, G.D. Abowd, and J. Fogarty.

16.  Fritz, T., Huang, E.M., Murphy, G.C., and
Cordeiro, F., Epstein, D.A., Thomaz, E., Bales, E., Jagannathan, A.K., Abowd, G.D., and Fogarty, J.

The  full  survey  consisted  of  free  response  questions  about 
each current and previous tool, asking why they started and 
stopped using that tool as appropriate. The first two authors 
affinity diagrammed these responses, identified themes, and 
then separately qualitatively coded the responses, iteratively 
refining codes through discussion.
